MANUAL: multiChannelExample (1.16.1) 

multiChannelExample - example of feeding multiple channels into a
ChipStream for genotype calling.

usage:
   ./multiChannelExample -p CM=1.bins=100.K=2.SB=0.003.MS=0.05 \
       -o results \
       --read-models-brlmmp GenomeWideSNP_5.models \
       --chrX-snps GenomeWideSNP_5.chrx \
       --read-genders genders.txt


options:
   -h, --help                           This message. [default 'false'] 
     --explain Display documentation for algo method
                          parameters. [default ''] 
   -v, --verbose How verbose to be with status messages 0 -
                          quiet, 1 - usual messages, 2 - more
                          messages. [default '1'] 
     --cel-files File listing CEL files to process. There
                          must be a 'sample_name' column, and 2 or
                          more 'channel_*'. Current channels are
                          ordered (starting with 0) by the order in
                          this file. [default ''] 
   -d, --cdf-file CDF file providing chip layout information.
                          [default ''] 
     --spf-file SPF file providing chip layout information.
                          [default ''] 
     --channel-file Channel file providing info on what alleles
                          are in what channel for each SNP. There
                          should be a row for each SNP. There must be
                          a 'probeset_id', 'allele_A_channel', and an
                          'allele_B_channel' columns. The value
                          corresponds to the channels in the
                          --cel-files specified file. Valid values 
                          are integers >= 0. [default ''] 
   -p, --algo-params A string specifying algo parameters. See
                          --explain option for acceptable parameters.
                          [default ''] 
   -a, --expr-analysis Expression analysis string. [default ''] 
   -o, --out-dir Directory to write result files into.
                          [default '.'] 
     --version Display version information. [default
                          'false'] 
     --chrX-snps File containing snps on chrX
                          (non-pseudoautosomal region). [default ''] 
     --special-snps File containing all snps of unusual copy
                          (chrX,mito,Y) [default ''] 
     --write-models Should we write snp specific models out for
                          analysis? [experimental] [default 'false'] 
     --summaries Should we write out the allele summaries
                          [default 'false'] 
     --feature-effects Output feature effects when available.
                          [default 'false'] 
     --feature-details Output probe by chip specific details 
                          (often residuals) when available. [default
                          'false'] 
     --read-models-brlmmp File to read precomputed BRLMM-P snp
                          specific models from. [default ''] 
     --read-genders Explicitly read genders from a file.
                          [default ''] 
     --genotypes File to read seed genotypes from. [default
                          ''] 
     --select-probes evaluate probe/probe-set quality [default
                          'false'] 
     --target-sketch File specifying a target distribution to 
                          use for quantile normalization. [default 
                          ''] 
     --write-sketch Write the quantile normalization
                          distribution (or sketch) to a file for 
                          reuse with target-sketch option. [default
                          'false'] 
   NON-OFFICIAL-RELEASE
   $Id: multiChannelExample.cpp,v 1.34 2009-10-30 07:20:38 csugne Exp $

Q. Do you have a question?

A. No, I do not.
